::: {.content_mcptgg__MGAfu test-id="templates/individual/content" style="overflow-wrap:break-word"}
## Next.js + PostgreSQL Auth Starter {#next.js-postgresql-auth-starter .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
starter kit that uses
[NextAuth.js](https://next-auth.js.org/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} for
simple email + password login,
[Drizzle](https://orm.drizzle.team){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
the ORM, and a [Neon
Postgres](https://vercel.com/postgres){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
database to persist the data.

### Deploy Your Own {#deploy-your-own .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can clone & deploy it to Vercel with one click:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?demo-title=Next.js%20Prisma%20PostgreSQL%20Auth%20Starter&demo-description=Simple%20Next.js%2013%20starter%20kit%20that%20uses%20Next-Auth%20for%20auth%20and%20Prisma%20PostgreSQL%20as%20a%20database.&demo-url=https%3A%2F%2Fnextjs-postgres-auth.vercel.app%2F&demo-image=%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fe5382hct74si%2F7rsVQ1ZBSiWe9JGO6FUeZZ%2F210cba91036ca912b2770e0bd5d6cc5d%2Fthumbnail.png&project-name=Next.js%25%20Prisma%20PostgreSQL%20Auth%20Starter&repository-name=nextjs-postgres-auth-starter&repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fnextjs-postgres-auth-starter&from=templates&skippable-integrations=1&env=AUTH_SECRET&envDescription=Generate%20a%20random%20secret%3A&envLink=https://generate-secret.vercel.app/&stores=%5B%7B%22type%22%3A%22postgres%22%7D%5D){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### Developing Locally {#developing-locally .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can clone & create this repo with the following command

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npx create-next-app nextjs-typescript-starter --example "https://github.com/vercel/nextjs-postgres-auth-starter"
```

### Getting Started {#getting-started .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

First, run the development server:

## Next.js + PostgreSQL Auth Starter {#next.js-postgresql-auth-starter-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
starter kit that uses
[NextAuth.js](https://next-auth.js.org/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} for
simple email + password login,
[Drizzle](https://orm.drizzle.team){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
the ORM, and a [Neon
Postgres](https://vercel.com/postgres){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
database to persist the data.

### Deploy Your Own {#deploy-your-own-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can clone & deploy it to Vercel with one click:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?demo-title=Next.js%20Prisma%20PostgreSQL%20Auth%20Starter&demo-description=Simple%20Next.js%2013%20starter%20kit%20that%20uses%20Next-Auth%20for%20auth%20and%20Prisma%20PostgreSQL%20as%20a%20database.&demo-url=https%3A%2F%2Fnextjs-postgres-auth.vercel.app%2F&demo-image=%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fe5382hct74si%2F7rsVQ1ZBSiWe9JGO6FUeZZ%2F210cba91036ca912b2770e0bd5d6cc5d%2Fthumbnail.png&project-name=Next.js%25%20Prisma%20PostgreSQL%20Auth%20Starter&repository-name=nextjs-postgres-auth-starter&repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fnextjs-postgres-auth-starter&from=templates&skippable-integrations=1&env=AUTH_SECRET&envDescription=Generate%20a%20random%20secret%3A&envLink=https://generate-secret.vercel.app/&stores=%5B%7B%22type%22%3A%22postgres%22%7D%5D){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### Developing Locally {#developing-locally-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can clone & create this repo with the following command

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npx create-next-app nextjs-typescript-starter --example "https://github.com/vercel/nextjs-postgres-auth-starter"
```

### Getting Started {#getting-started-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

First, run the development server:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
your browser to see the result.

### Learn More {#learn-more-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:

- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} -
  learn about Next.js features and API.
- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} -
  an interactive Next.js tutorial.

You can check out [the Next.js GitHub
repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} -
your feedback and contributions are welcome!
:::

::: {.content_mcptgg__MGAfu test-id="templates/individual/content" style="overflow-wrap:break-word"}
## Vercel Postgres + Drizzle ORM + pgvector Next.js Starter {#vercel-postgres-drizzle-orm-pgvector-next.js-starter .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

A Next.js template that uses [Vercel
Postgres](https://vercel.com/postgres){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
the database, [Drizzle ORM](https://orm.drizzle.team/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
the ORM with
[pgvector](https://github.com/pgvector/pgvector-node#drizzle-orm){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
enable vector similarity search, and OpenAI\'s
[`text-embedding-ada-002`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/embeddings){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} model
for embeddings.

### Demo {#demo .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://postgres-pgvector.vercel.app/](https://postgres-pgvector.vercel.app/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=vercel-examples){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fexamples%2Ftree%2Fmain%2Fstorage%2Fpostgres-pgvector&env=OPENAI_API_KEY&envDescription=Get+your+OpenAI+API+key+here%3A&envLink=https%3A%2F%2Fplatform.openai.com%2Faccount%2Fapi-keys&project-name=postgres-pgvector&repository-name=postgres-pgvector&demo-title=Vercel+Postgres+%2B+Prisma+%2B+pgvector+Next.js+Starter&demo-description=A+Next.js+template+that+uses+Vercel+Postgres+as+the+database%2C+Prisma+as+the+ORM+with+pgvector+to+enable+vector+similarity+search%2C+and+OpenAI%E2%80%99s+models+for+text+embeddings.&demo-url=https%3A%2F%2Fpostgres-pgvector.vercel.app&demo-image=https%3A%2F%2Fpostgres-pgvector.vercel.app%2Fopengraph-image.png&stores=%5B%7B%22type%22%3A%22kv%22%7D%2C%7B%22type%22%3A%22postgres%22%7D%5D){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/storage/postgres-pgvector
```

Once that\'s done, copy the .env.example file in this directory to
.env.local (which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.example .env.local
```

Then open `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} and set the environment variables to match the ones
in your Vercel Storage Dashboard.

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Deploy it to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=vercel-examples){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).
:::

## Vercel Postgres + Drizzle ORM + pgvector Next.js Starter {#vercel-postgres-drizzle-orm-pgvector-next.js-starter-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

A Next.js template that uses [Vercel
Postgres](https://vercel.com/postgres){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
the database, [Drizzle ORM](https://orm.drizzle.team/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
the ORM with
[pgvector](https://github.com/pgvector/pgvector-node#drizzle-orm){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
enable vector similarity search, and OpenAI\'s
[`text-embedding-ada-002`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/embeddings){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} model
for embeddings.

### Demo {#demo-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://postgres-pgvector.vercel.app/](https://postgres-pgvector.vercel.app/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=vercel-examples){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fexamples%2Ftree%2Fmain%2Fstorage%2Fpostgres-pgvector&env=OPENAI_API_KEY&envDescription=Get+your+OpenAI+API+key+here%3A&envLink=https%3A%2F%2Fplatform.openai.com%2Faccount%2Fapi-keys&project-name=postgres-pgvector&repository-name=postgres-pgvector&demo-title=Vercel+Postgres+%2B+Prisma+%2B+pgvector+Next.js+Starter&demo-description=A+Next.js+template+that+uses+Vercel+Postgres+as+the+database%2C+Prisma+as+the+ORM+with+pgvector+to+enable+vector+similarity+search%2C+and+OpenAI%E2%80%99s+models+for+text+embeddings.&demo-url=https%3A%2F%2Fpostgres-pgvector.vercel.app&demo-image=https%3A%2F%2Fpostgres-pgvector.vercel.app%2Fopengraph-image.png&stores=%5B%7B%22type%22%3A%22kv%22%7D%2C%7B%22type%22%3A%22postgres%22%7D%5D){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/storage/postgres-pgvector
```

Once that\'s done, copy the .env.example file in this directory to
.env.local (which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.example .env.local
```

Then open `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} and set the environment variables to match the ones
in your Vercel Storage Dashboard.

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Deploy it to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=vercel-examples){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).
:::

## Postgres Next.js Starter {#postgres-next.js-starter-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Simple Next.js template that uses a Postgres database.

### Demo {#demo .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://postgres-starter.vercel.app/](https://postgres-starter.vercel.app/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=vercel-examples){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fexamples%2Ftree%2Fmain%2Fstorage%2Fpostgres-starter&project-name=postgres-starter&repository-name=postgres-starter&demo-title=Vercel%20Postgres%20Next.js%20Starter&demo-description=Simple%20Next.js%20template%20that%20uses%20Vercel%20Postgres%20as%20the%20database.&demo-url=https%3A%2F%2Fpostgres-starter.vercel.app%2F&demo-image=https%3A%2F%2Fpostgres-starter.vercel.app%2Fopengraph-image.png&products=%5B%7B%22type%22%3A%22integration%22%2C%22group%22%3A%22postgres%22%7D%5D){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/storage/postgres-starter
```

Once that\'s done, copy the .env.example file in this directory to
.env.local (which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.example .env.local
```

Then open `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} and set the environment variables to match the ones
in your Vercel Storage Dashboard.

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Deploy it to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=vercel-examples){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).
:::
